Paragraph.Text: for legal services retained to collect or attempt to collect the payment;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in realizing on any security interest taken under the credit agreement or in protecting such a security interest, including the cost of legal services retained for that purpose;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in processing a cheque or other instrument that the person used to make a payment under the loan but that was dishonoured; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: for any prescribed purpose.

Section.Text: If a natural person enters into a credit agreement other than for business purposes with an institution for a loan that is secured by a mortgage on real property and that is to be renewed on a specified day,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the institution shall not, during any prescribed period, make a change to the agreement that increases the cost of borrowing; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the person’s rights under the agreement continue, and the renewal does not take effect, until the prescribed day.

Section.MarginalNote: No increase or provision without express consent

Subsection.Text: Subject to any regulations, an institution shall not

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: increase the credit limit on a line of credit that is extended — or a credit card account that is opened — in Canada for a natural person other than for business purposes without first obtaining the person’s express consent to do so; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: provide cheques that are issued on a credit card account that is opened in Canada for a natural person other than for business purposes without first obtaining the person’s express consent to do so.

Subsection.Text: If the consent is given orally, the institution shall provide the person with written confirmation of the consent not later than the date of the first statement of account that is provided after the date of that consent.

Use by the person of the line of credit or the credit card account, or of any service related to the line of credit or credit card account, does not constitute express consent for the purpose of subsection (1).

The maximum liability of a borrower for the unauthorized use of a credit card issued to them in Canada, the account information of the credit card or the personal authentication information created or adopted in relation to the credit card or credit card account is $50, unless the borrower has demonstrated gross negligence or, in Quebec, gross fault, in safeguarding the credit card, the account information or the personal authentication information.

If a borrower reports to an institution that a credit card issued to them in Canada, the account information of the credit card or the personal authentication information created or adopted in relation to the credit card or credit card account has been lost or stolen or is otherwise at risk of being used in an unauthorized manner, the borrower shall not be liable for any unauthorized use of the credit card, the account information or the personal authentication information after the report is received.

The unauthorized use of a credit card issued to a borrower in Canada, or of account information of the credit card, by means of the personal authentication information created or adopted in relation to the credit card or credit card account does not by itself establish that the borrower demonstrated gross negligence or, in Quebec, gross fault, in safeguarding the personal authentication information.

Subject to any regulations, an institution shall, for a credit card issued in Canada to a natural person other than for business purposes, send a statement of account in respect of each billing cycle to the person. The statement is to be sent without delay after the last day of the billing cycle.

An institution shall not require a minimum payment in respect of the outstanding balance owing for a particular billing cycle on the credit card account to be made by the person less than 21 days after the last day of that billing cycle.

If the due date for a minimum payment in respect of the outstanding balance owing on the credit card account does not fall on a business day, the institution shall consider a payment made on the next business day as being made on time.

Subsection.MarginalNote: No interest if balance paid in full
Subsection.Text: An institution shall not impose interest on purchases of goods or services made during a particular billing cycle on the credit card account if the person pays the outstanding balance owing on the credit card account in full on or before the due date.

Section.MarginalNote: Different interest rates — allocation of payment

Subsection.Text: If different interest rates apply to different amounts owing for a particular billing cycle on a credit card account that is opened in Canada by a natural person other than for business purposes, the institution shall allocate any payment made by the person that is greater than the required minimum payment for that billing cycle among those amounts using one of the following methods:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: by allocating that payment first to the amount with the highest interest rate and then allocating any remaining portion of the payment to the other amounts in descending order, based on their applicable interest rates; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: by allocating that payment among those amounts in the same proportion as each amount bears to the outstanding balance owing on the credit card account.

Subsection.Text: For the purpose of paragraph (1)(b), if the payment that the institution allocates to an amount owing on a credit card account contains a fraction of a dollar, the institution may round up that amount to the nearest dollar if the fraction of the dollar is equal to or greater than 50 cents, round down that amount to the nearest dollar if the fraction is less than 50 cents and, if necessary, make corresponding adjustments to the other amounts that are being allocated.

An institution shall not impose a charge on a natural person for exceeding their credit limit as a result of a hold on a credit card that was issued in Canada to the person other than for business purposes.
Subsection (1) does not apply if the person would, in any case, have exceeded their credit limit during the period in which the hold was in effect.

Section.Text: In its dealings with a natural person who owes it a debt under a credit agreement entered into other than for business purposes, an institution

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall not communicate or attempt to communicate with the person, any member of the person’s family or household, any relative, neighbour, friend or acquaintance of the person or the person’s employer by any means that constitutes harassment, in a manner that constitutes harassment or with a frequency that constitutes harassment, including by

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: using threatening, profane, intimidating or coercive language,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: using undue pressure, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: making public, or threatening to make public, the person’s failure to pay; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: shall comply with any other prescribed debt collection practices.

Section.Text: An institution shall not impose an expiry date on the right of a person with whom it entered into an agreement for the issuance of a prepaid payment product to use the funds that are loaded on the product unless it is a promotional product.
An institution shall not impose any maintenance charges in respect of a prepaid payment product for the period of 12 months after the day on which the product is activated unless it is

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a promotional product; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a reloadable product for which the institution has obtained the express consent of the person with whom it entered into an agreement for the issuance of the product to the imposition of the charge.

Section.MarginalNote: No overdraft charges without express consent

Subsection.Text: An institution shall not impose any overdraft charges in respect of a prepaid payment product without first obtaining the express consent of the person with whom it entered into an agreement for the issuance of the product.
Use by the person of the prepaid payment product does not constitute express consent for the purpose of subsection (1).

Section.Text: An institution shall not provide an optional product or service to a natural person — other than for business purposes — in an agreement in respect of another product or service.

Subsection.Text: If an optional product or service, or a product or service that would have been an optional product or service if it had been provided for an additional charge, is provided to a natural person — other than for business purposes — under a promotional, preferential, introductory or special offer other than an offer referred to in subsection (2), an institution shall not impose any charges for the use of the product or service as of the day on which the person will no longer benefit from the offer without obtaining, within five business days before that day, the person’s express consent to impose that charge.

If an optional product or service, or a product or service that would have been an optional product or service if it had been provided for an additional charge, is provided to a natural person — other than for business purposes — under a promotional, preferential, introductory or special offer based on a specified number of uses, an institution shall not impose any charges after the last use of the product or service without obtaining, immediately after the last use, the person’s express consent to impose that charge.
Use by the person of the product or service does not constitute express consent for the purpose of subsections (1) and (2).
An institution shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: establish procedures that are satisfactory to the Commissioner for dealing, within the prescribed period, with complaints;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: designate one of its officers or employees in Canada to be responsible for implementing those procedures; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: designate one or more of its officers or employees in Canada to receive and deal with those complaints.

Subsection.Text: An institution shall not use any misleading term with respect to its procedures or designated officers or employees, including any term that suggests that the procedures, officers or employees are independent of the institution — such as the term “ombudsman” or any other term with a similar meaning — or any prescribed term.
An institution shall file a copy of its procedures as amended from time to time with the Commissioner.
An institution shall provide a person who makes a complaint with

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a written acknowledgment of the date on which it received the complaint;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the information referred to in paragraphs 627.65(a) to (c); and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: any information that is necessary to enable them to meet the requirements of the procedures referred to in paragraph 627.65(a).

Section.Text: An institution shall make, with respect to a complaint referred to in paragraph 627.43(1)(a), a record that is to be retained for a period of at least seven years and that contains

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if the complaint was made in writing, the original version of the complaint;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the complaint was made orally,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the recording or a transcript of the recording if the complaint was recorded, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the details of the complaint if the complaint was not recorded;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the person who made the complaint;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the person who requested or received from the institution the product or service to which the complaint relates;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the contact information provided by the person who made the complaint;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the date on which the institution received the complaint;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the nature of the complaint and the product or service to which the complaint relates;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the date on which the complaint was resolved if, in the institution’s opinion, it was resolved to the satisfaction of the person who made the complaint;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: a description of any actions that were taken by the institution to attempt to resolve the complaint;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: a description of any compensation provided to the persons referred to in paragraph (c) or (d);

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: confirmation that the institution provided the information referred to in paragraphs 627.65(a) to (c) to the person who made the complaint, if the institution did so; and

Paragraph.Label: (l)
Paragraph.Text: any prescribed information.

Section.Text: The institution shall ensure that the record retained under section 627.44 is accessible to the Commissioner.

Within 60 days after the end of each quarter, an institution shall submit to the Commissioner in a form satisfactory to him or her, with respect to each complaint received by an officer or employee referred to in paragraph 627.43(1)(c) during that quarter,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a copy of the record retained under section 627.44, except the contact information referred to in paragraph 627.44(e) other than the postal code; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: any prescribed information.

Section.Text: An institution shall, free of charge and within 135 days after the end of each financial year, make available the following information for that year on each of its websites through which it offers products or services in Canada and provide the information in writing to any person who requests it:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the number and nature of any complaints that were dealt with by the officer or employee designated by the institution to deal with complaints who holds the most senior position identified for that purpose in the procedures established by the institution;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the average length of time taken to deal with the complaints received by that officer or employee;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the number of complaints that, in the institution’s opinion, were resolved by that officer or employee to the satisfaction of the persons who made them; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: any prescribed information.

Section.Text: The purpose of sections 627.48 to 627.54 is to enhance the process for dealing with complaints by establishing a regime comprised of a sole external complaints body that discharges its functions and performs its activities in a transparent, effective, timely and fair manner based on the principles of accessibility, accountability, impartiality and independence.

Subsection.Text: The Minister may, on the recommendation of the Commissioner, designate a body corporate incorporated under the Canada Not-for-profit Corporations Act or under a provincial statute equivalent to that Act to be the external complaints body to deal with complaints referred to in paragraph 627.43(1)(a) that have not been resolved by its member institutions to the satisfaction of the persons who made the complaints or that have not been dealt with within the prescribed period referred to in that paragraph.
Before designating a body corporate, the Minister shall take into account all matters that the Minister considers relevant, including whether the body corporate has

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the reputation required under paragraph 627.49(a); and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: policies and procedures and terms of reference that would enable it to discharge its functions and perform its activities in a manner that is consistent with the purpose set out in section 627.471 and to comply with paragraphs 627.49(b) to (m).

Subsection.Text: Every institution shall be a member of the external complaints body.
The external complaints body is not an agent of His Majesty.
A designation made under subsection (1) shall be published in the Canada Gazette.

Section.Text: The external complaints body shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: maintain a reputation for being operated in a manner that is consistent with the standards of good character and integrity;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: make its services available across Canada in both official languages and offer those services free of charge to persons who make complaints to it;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: establish policies, procedures and terms of reference that are satisfactory to the Commissioner pertaining to, among other things, dealing with complaints and the consultation, at least once a year, of its member institutions and consumers for the purpose of raising concerns about the external complaints body;

Paragraph.Label: (c.1)
Paragraph.Text: establish the manner of calculating, to the satisfaction of the Commissioner, the fees it charges to each of its member institutions for its services;

Paragraph.Label: (c.2)
Paragraph.Text: make information available to consumers about their rights and responsibilities in relation to the external complaints handling regime, respond to their inquiries and requests for information and offer them assistance in making a complaint;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: inform the Commissioner in writing within 30 days after the day on which it determines that a complaint raises a potential systemic issue;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: if it determines that all or part of a complaint is not within its terms of reference, provide the person who made the complaint with written reasons for that determination, and the name of any entity to whom the person may make a complaint, within 30 days after the day on which it receives the complaint;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: obtain confirmation from a member institution to which a complaint relates regarding whether the period referred to in paragraph 627.43(1)(a) has ended, unless the person who made the complaint has provided it with the written acknowledgment referred to in paragraph 627.43(4)(a);

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: impartially deal with complaints referred to in paragraph 627.43(1)(a) that have not been resolved by its member institutions to the satisfaction of the persons who made the complaints or that have not been dealt with within the prescribed period referred to in that paragraph;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: no later than 120 days after the day on which it has all of the information that it requires to deal with a complaint, make a final written recommendation to the parties;

Paragraph.Label: (h.1)
Paragraph.Text: without delay, inform the Commissioner in writing of cases in which an institution does not comply with a final recommendation;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: within 90 days after making a final recommendation, make a summary of the final recommendation available on its website free of charge, which summary is to include

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a description of the nature of the complaint that is the subject of the final recommendation,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the name of the institution that received the complaint,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a description of any compensation provided to the persons referred to in paragraph 627.44(c) or (d),

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the reasons for the final recommendation, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: any prescribed information;

Paragraph.Label: (i.1)
Paragraph.Text: within 60 days after the end of each quarter, submit to the Commissioner, in a form satisfactory to the Commissioner,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in relation to all investigations completed during the quarter, a copy of the record of the complaint, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: any prescribed information;

Paragraph.Label: (i.2)
Paragraph.Text: within 60 days after the end of each quarter, meet with the Commissioner to discuss, among other things, complaints, operations and market trends and issues with the potential to impact consumers;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: within 135 days after the end of each financial year, file a written report with the Commissioner on the performance of its functions and activities for that year, which report is to include

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: information about

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: its constitution, governance and terms of reference, and the identity of its member institutions,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: all sources of funding for its functions and activities, including the fees charged to each of its member institutions for its services and the manner in which those fees are calculated, and

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: the results of the most recent evaluation referred to in paragraph (l),

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a summary of the results of any consultation with its member institutions and with persons who made complaints to it,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: in respect of each of its member institutions, the number and nature of complaints that it received, the number of complaints that it determined were within its terms of reference, the number of final recommendations that it made and the number of complaints that, in its opinion, were resolved to the satisfaction of the persons who made them,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the average length of time taken to deal with complaints,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the number of complaints that it determined were not within its terms of reference and the reasons for that determination,

Subparagraph.Label: (v.1)
Subparagraph.Text: the number of complaints for which an institution did not comply with a final recommendation,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: the number of final recommendations that it made in which compensation was recommended, and

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: the average and total compensation provided with respect to complaints that it determined were within its terms of reference;

Paragraph.Label: (j.1)
Paragraph.Text: meet with the Commissioner annually;

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: without delay after it is filed with the Commissioner, make the report available on its website free of charge and provide it to any person who requests it;

Paragraph.Label: (l)
Paragraph.Text: submit, every five years, to an evaluation of the performance of its functions and activities that is conducted, at the discretion of the Commissioner, by the Commissioner or a third party in accordance with terms of reference that are established by the external complaints body in consultation with the Commissioner; and

Paragraph.Label: (m)
Paragraph.Text: meet any prescribed requirement.

Section.MarginalNote: Provision of information — external complaints body
Section.Text: An institution shall provide the external complaints body with all information in its possession or control that relates to a complaint in respect of the institution without delay after the external complaints body notifies it that the complaint has been received.
If an institution or a body corporate is required under sections 627.43 to 627.52 to provide information, it shall do so in a manner, and using language, that is clear, simple and not misleading.
The Commissioner shall include in the report referred to in section 34 of the Financial Consumer Agency of Canada Act

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the procedures for dealing with complaints established by institutions under paragraph 627.43(1)(a);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the number and nature of complaints that have been made to the Agency; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a summary of the information referred to in section 627.47 and the information in the report referred to in paragraph 627.49(j).

Heading.Label: DIVISION 3
Heading.TitleText: Disclosure and Transparency for Informed Decisions

Subsection.Text: If an institution is required under this Division to disclose information, it shall do so in a manner, and using language, that is clear, simple and not misleading, and shall do so in writing, unless otherwise provided for under this Division.

Subject to the regulations, an institution that enters into an agreement with a person orally by telephone in respect of a product or service in Canada is deemed to have disclosed in writing the information referred to in subsection (1) if it

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: discloses orally to the person, before entering into the agreement by telephone,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the information or any prescribed portion of the information, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: any prescribed information; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: provides the information in writing to the person without delay after entering into the agreement.

Section.Text: If an institution is required under this Division to disclose information to its customers and to the public, it shall do so by

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: displaying the information prominently

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: at each of its branches in Canada where it offers products or services and at each of its points of service, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: on each of its websites through which it offers products or services in Canada; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: providing the information in writing to any person who requests it.

Subsection.Text: If an institution is required under this Division to disclose information in an application form or before entering into an agreement in respect of a product or service, it shall, at the time of that disclosure, disclose the information that is prescribed by presenting it prominently in a single prominently displayed information box.
An institution shall orally draw attention to the information that is required to be disclosed in the information box when

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the institution solicits applications for the product or service from a person orally by telephone; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a person contacts the institution orally by telephone for the purpose of applying for the product or service.

Section.Text: Subject to the regulations, an institution shall, before entering into an agreement with a person by electronic means or by mail in respect of a product or service in Canada, provide the person with the local or toll-free telephone number of a natural person who is an employee or agent of the institution and who is knowledgeable about the terms and conditions of the agreement.

An institution shall, before entering into an agreement with a natural person in respect of any product or service in Canada to be provided on an ongoing basis and for which disclosure obligations are not otherwise provided under this Division, disclose to that person

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the features of the product or service;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a list of all charges and penalties applicable to the product or service;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: particulars of the person’s rights and obligations in respect of the product or service;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the information referred to in paragraphs 627.65(a) to (c); and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: any prescribed information.

Subsection.Text: If an institution enters into an agreement with a natural person other than for business purposes in respect of a product or service in Canada — other than a loan that is secured by a mortgage on real property — and the agreement provides that a product or service may be renewed or that, after the end of the term of the product or service, a new product or service may be provided to the person without a further agreement being entered into, the institution shall disclose to the person the information set out in subsection (2),

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a product or service that is provided for a term of more than 30 days, 21 days before, and five days before, the last day of the term; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a product or service that is provided for a term of 30 days or less, five days before the last day of the term.

Subsection.Text: The information to be disclosed is the following:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the interest rate that will be applicable to the product or service on its renewal, or to the new product or service;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: any charges or penalties that may be imposed on the person in relation to the product or service on its renewal, or to the new product or service;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: particulars of the person’s rights and obligations in relation to the product or service on its renewal, or to the new product or service;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the period within which the institution shall allow the person to cancel the agreement in respect of the product or service that may be renewed, or in respect of the new product or service; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: any prescribed information.

Subsection.Text: If a natural person accepts, other than for business purposes, a promotional, preferential, introductory or special offer with respect to a product or service other than an optional product or service, the institution shall disclose to the person the information set out in subsection (2),

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if the period during which the person will benefit from the offer is more than 30 days, 21 days before, and five days before, the last day of the period; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the period during which the person will benefit from the offer is 30 days or less, five days before the last day of the period.

Subsection.Text: The information to be disclosed is the following:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the interest rate that will be applicable to the product or service after the day on which the person will no longer benefit from the offer;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: any charges or penalties that may be imposed on the person in relation to the product or service after the day on which the person will no longer benefit from the offer;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: particulars of the person’s rights and obligations in relation to the product or service after the day on which the person will no longer benefit from the offer;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the period within which the institution shall allow the person to cancel the agreement in respect of the product or service after the day on which the person will no longer benefit from the offer; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: any prescribed information.

Section.Text: An institution shall, before any prescribed amendment that it makes to a term or condition of an agreement with a person in respect of a product or service in Canada takes effect, disclose prescribed information to the person or any other person as directed by that person.

If an institution is required under this Division to disclose information in an advertisement, it shall do so by presenting it prominently — as specified in any regulations — within the advertisement.
An institution shall disclose to its customers and to the public the fact that it shall not, under section 627.04,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: impose undue pressure on a person, or coerce a person, for any purpose, including to obtain a product or service from a particular person, as a condition for obtaining another product or service from the institution; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: take advantage of a person.

Section.Text: An institution shall disclose to its customers and to the public

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: its procedures for dealing with complaints established under paragraph 627.43(1)(a);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the external complaints body and the manner in which that body may be contacted; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the Agency’s mailing address, website address and telephone number.

Section.MarginalNote: Voluntary codes of conduct and public commitments
Section.Text: An institution shall disclose the voluntary codes of conduct that it has adopted, that are designed to protect the interests of its customers and that are publicly available — and the public commitments that it has made and that are designed to protect the interests of its customers — by

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: making the voluntary codes and commitments available

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: at each of its branches in Canada where it offers products or services and at each of its points of service, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: on each of its websites through which it offers products or services in Canada; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: providing the voluntary codes and commitments in writing to any person who requests them.

Heading.TitleText: Deposit Accounts, Financial Instruments and Notes

Section.MarginalNote: Member banks — customers and the public
Section.Text: A member bank shall disclose to its customers and to the public

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the conditions to be met for the opening of a retail deposit account by a natural person under subsections 627.17(1) and (3);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the personal identification requirements set out in paragraph 627.25(1)(b); and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: any prescribed information.

Section.Text: An institution shall disclose to its customers and to the public

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a list of all charges applicable to personal deposit accounts in Canada with the institution and the usual amount, if any, charged by the institution for services normally provided in Canada to its customers and to the public;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: for a deposit account in Canada other than a personal deposit account,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a list of all charges applicable to any prescribed services that it provides in respect of the account and the fact that the list sets out all such charges, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a partial list of those charges and the manner in which information regarding charges not included in the list can be obtained;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the maximum periods during which the institution may hold funds deposited by cheque or other instrument before making them available for withdrawal, as set out in section 627.21; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the institution’s policies concerning the maximum period during which the institution may hold funds deposited by cheque or other instrument in any situation to which section 627.21 does not apply.

Subsection.Text: An institution shall, before entering into an agreement with a person for the opening of a deposit account in Canada, disclose to the person

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: subject to subsection (2), a list of all charges applicable to the account;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a personal deposit account, the circumstances in which the institution shall send the person an alert, in accordance with section 627.13;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a retail deposit account,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the rate of interest and the manner in which the amount of interest is calculated,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the maximum periods during which the institution may hold funds deposited by cheque or other instrument before making them available for withdrawal, as set out in section 627.21, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the institution’s policies concerning the maximum period during which the institution may hold funds deposited by cheque or other instrument in any situation to which section 627.21 does not apply; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: any prescribed information.

Subsection.MarginalNote: If amount of charge cannot be determined
Subsection.Text: If the amount of a charge referred to in paragraph (1)(a) cannot be determined before an agreement is entered into for the opening of a deposit account other than a personal deposit account, the institution shall, without delay after the amount is determined, disclose that amount to the person in whose name the account is kept.

An institution shall disclose any changes to the information referred to in paragraph 627.68(c) or (d) to its customers and to the public for a period of at least 60 days ending on the effective date of the change, and disclose any changes to the information referred to in subparagraph 627.69(1)(c)(ii) or (iii) to each person in whose name the retail deposit account is kept and to whom a statement of account is provided — or to any other person as directed by that person — at least 30 days before the effective date of the change.

If the change results in a shortened period during which an institution may hold funds deposited by cheque or other instrument, the institution may meet the obligations set out in subsection (1) after the effective date of the change.

Section.MarginalNote: Change in rate of interest or manner of calculation
Section.Text: If there is a change in the rate of interest that is applicable to a deposit account in Canada or in the manner in which the amount of interest for such an account is calculated, an institution shall, without delay, disclose the change

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: to the person in whose name the account is kept or to any other person as directed by that person; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: to the public by displaying it prominently

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: at each of its branches in Canada where it offers deposit accounts and at each of its points of service, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: on each of its websites through which it offers deposit accounts in Canada.

Subsection.Text: An institution shall disclose to a person to whom a statement of account is provided — or to any other person as directed by that person — any increase to a charge applicable to a personal deposit account in Canada — or applicable to a prescribed service in relation to deposit accounts in Canada, other than personal deposit accounts — or any new charge applicable to a personal deposit account in Canada at least 30 days before the effective date of the increase or new charge.

If there is a person in whose name the account is kept to whom a statement of account is not provided, an institution shall disclose to its customers and to the public any increase referred to in subsection (1) for a period of at least 60 days ending on the effective date of the increase or new charge, and if the increase or new charge is applicable to a personal deposit account, by displaying the increase or new charge prominently at each automated teller machine on which the name of the institution or information identifying the machine with the institution is displayed.
An institution shall, to meet its obligations under subsection (2), also disclose the manner in which further details with respect to the increase or new charge can be obtained.

Section.MarginalNote: Authorized foreign banks — customers and the public
Section.Text: An authorized foreign bank that is not subject to the restrictions and requirements referred to in subsection 524(2) and a bank referred to in paragraph 413(1)(b) or (c) shall disclose to their customers and to the public that deposits with them are not insured by the Canada Deposit Insurance Corporation.

Section.MarginalNote: Authorized foreign banks — customers and the public
Section.Text: An authorized foreign bank that is subject to this section under an order referred to in subsection 524(2) shall disclose to its customers and to the public that it does not accept deposits in Canada and that it is not a member institution of the Canada Deposit Insurance Corporation.

Section.MarginalNote: Authorized foreign banks — deposit accounts and agreements for prescribed products
Section.Text: An authorized foreign bank that is not subject to the restrictions and requirements referred to in subsection 524(2) shall, before entering into an agreement with a person for the opening of a deposit account in Canada or in respect of a prescribed product that relates to a deposit,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: disclose to the person the fact that deposits to the deposit account or in relation to the prescribed product, as the case may be, are not insured by the Canada Deposit Insurance Corporation, as well as any prescribed information; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: obtain the person’s signature immediately next to the disclosure statement.

Section.MarginalNote: Certain banks — deposit accounts and agreements for prescribed products

Subsection.Text: A bank referred to in paragraph 413(1)(b) or (c) shall, before entering into an agreement with a person for the opening of a deposit account in Canada or in respect of a prescribed product that relates to a deposit, disclose to the person the fact that deposits to the deposit account or in relation to the prescribed product are not insured by the Canada Deposit Insurance Corporation.

A bank referred to in paragraph 413(1)(b) or (c) that shares premises with a member institution as defined in section 2 of the Canada Deposit Insurance Corporation Act shall, before entering into an agreement with a person for the opening of a deposit account in Canada or in respect of a prescribed product that relates to a deposit,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: disclose to the person

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the fact that the bank’s business is separate and distinct from that of the member institution, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the fact that deposits to the deposit account or in relation to the prescribed product are not insured by the Canada Deposit Insurance Corporation;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: orally explain to the person the information that is to be disclosed under paragraph (a); and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: obtain from the person a signed declaration stating that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the person has been given all of the information that is to be disclosed under paragraph (a) and has read it,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the bank has orally explained all the information that is to be disclosed under paragraph (a), and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the person understands all of the information that is to be disclosed under paragraph (a).

Section.Text: An institution shall disclose prescribed information with respect to a deposit-type instrument, a principal-protected note or a prescribed product by

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: making the information available

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: at each of its branches in Canada and points of service where it offers any of these products, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: on each of its websites through which it offers these products in Canada; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: providing the information to any person who requests it.

Subsection.Text: An institution shall, before entering into an agreement with a person for the issuance of a deposit-type instrument, a principal-protected note or a prescribed product, disclose to the person

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the term of the product, how and when the principal is to be repaid and how and when the interest, if any, is to be paid;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the rate of interest in respect of the product is fixed, the annual rate of interest or, if the rate of interest is variable,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: how the rate of interest is determined,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the prime lending rate or the interest rate benchmark, as the case may be, that is used for the calculation of the rate of interest,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the prime lending rate or the interest rate benchmark in effect when the information is disclosed, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: how the person may obtain the rate of interest from the institution during the investment period;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: any charges applicable to the product and their impact on the interest payable;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: how interest is accrued and any limitations in respect of the interest payable;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: any risks associated with the product, including, if applicable, the risk that no interest may accrue;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: if the product relates to a deposit that is not eligible for deposit insurance coverage by the Canada Deposit Insurance Corporation, the fact that it is not eligible;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: whether the person may cancel their purchase of the product and, if so, how the purchase may be cancelled;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: whether the proposed agreement provides that the institution may amend a term or condition with respect to the product and, if so, in what circumstances;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: whether the manner in which the product is structured or administered may place the institution in a conflict of interest;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: any other information that could reasonably be expected to affect the person’s decision to enter into the agreement; and

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: any prescribed information.

Subsection.MarginalNote: New instrument issued without further agreement
Subsection.Text: If, after the maturity of a deposit-type instrument issued under an agreement referred to in subsection (1), an institution issues a new deposit-type instrument under that agreement, the institution shall disclose prescribed information to the person without delay after the instrument is issued.

Section.Text: If a principal-protected note ceases to be linked to an index or reference point that was to be used to determine the interest payable under the note and, as a result, no interest will be paid, the institution shall, without delay, disclose that fact to the person to whom the note was issued.
An institution shall disclose the following information without delay to a person who makes a request concerning the value of a product referred to in section 627.78 that was issued to the person:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a principal-protected note,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the net asset value of the note on the day specified by the person and how that value is related to the interest payable under the note, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the last available measure, before the day specified by the person, of the index or reference point on which the interest is determined and how that measure is related to the interest payable under the note;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a deposit-type instrument, the amount of the principal and accrued interest on the day on which the request was made; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of any prescribed product, prescribed information.

Section.MarginalNote: Amendments — deposit-type instruments or prescribed products
Section.Text: An institution shall, before any amendment that it makes to a term or condition with respect to a deposit-type instrument or a prescribed product takes effect, disclose the amendment and its potential impact on the interest payable to the person to whom the instrument or product was issued.

An institution shall, before any amendment that it makes to a term or condition with respect to a principal-protected note that may have an impact on the interest payable under the note takes effect, disclose the amendment and its potential impact on the interest payable to the person to whom the note was issued. However, if it is not possible to make that disclosure before the time the amendment takes effect, the institution shall do so as soon as possible after that time.
An institution shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: before redeeming or purchasing a principal-protected note before its maturity on the request of the person to whom it was issued, disclose to that person

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the value of the note on the last business day before the day on which the request is made, or the value of the note based on the last available measure of the index or reference point on which the interest is determined,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the amount of any charge or penalty,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the net amount that the person would have received for the redemption or purchase after deducting the amount referred to in subparagraph (ii) from the value of the note referred to in subparagraph (i), and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the time at which and the manner in which the value of the note will be calculated, and the fact that the value of the note may differ from the value referred to in subparagraph (i);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: before redeeming a deposit-type instrument before its maturity on the request of the person to whom it was issued, disclose to that person the amount of the principal and accrued interest, the amount of any charge or penalty and the net amount payable by the institution on redemption; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: before redeeming any prescribed product before its maturity on the request of the person to whom it was issued, disclose to that person prescribed information.

Section.Text: For the purposes of sections 627.8 and 627.83, the institution shall disclose the information in the same manner in which the request is made unless otherwise directed by the person.

An institution shall — in any advertisement in Canada in which it indicates the rate of interest that it offers on a deposit or debt obligation — disclose the manner in which the amount of interest is calculated and any circumstances that will affect the rate of interest, including the balance of a deposit account. The information shall be disclosed in the same manner in which the rate is indicated, whether visually or orally, or both.

An authorized foreign bank that is not subject to the restrictions and requirements referred to in subsection 524(2) and a bank referred to in paragraph 413(1)(b) or (c) shall — in any advertisement in Canada in respect of deposits — disclose, visually or orally, that deposits with it are not insured by the Canada Deposit Insurance Corporation.

Subsection.Text: An institution shall — in any advertisement in Canada for a product that is a deposit-type instrument, a principal-protected note or a prescribed product — disclose, visually or orally,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: how the public may obtain information about the product;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the advertisement refers to features of the product or the interest payable under it,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the manner in which interest is to be accrued and any limitations in respect of the interest payable, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the fact that the product relates to deposits that are not eligible to be insured by the Canada Deposit Insurance Corporation, if that is the case; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: any prescribed information.

Subsection.Text: Subparagraph (1)(b)(ii) does not apply to an authorized foreign bank that is not subject to the restrictions and requirements referred to in subsection 524(2) or a bank referred to in paragraph 413(1)(b) or (c).

An institution shall — in any advertisement in Canada for a principal-protected note in which it uses past market performance — disclose, visually or orally, the assumptions underlying any hypothetical examples used in the advertisement to represent that performance, and the fact that past market performance is not an indicator of future market performance.
The institution shall, in the advertisements referred to in subsection (3), represent the past market performance fairly and only use realistic assumptions to underlie hypothetical examples.

Section.Text: An institution shall disclose prescribed information with respect to a credit agreement by

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: making the information available

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: at each of its branches in Canada and points of service, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: on each of its websites through which it offers products or services in Canada; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: providing the information to any person who requests it.

Subsection.Text: An institution shall, before entering into a credit agreement with a natural person other than for business purposes, disclose to the person

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the cost of borrowing, as calculated and expressed in accordance with section 627.9;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: particulars of the person’s rights and obligations;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: any charges or penalties that may be imposed on the person;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a line of credit or credit card account, the circumstances in which the institution shall send the person an alert, in accordance with section 627.13; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: any prescribed information.

Subsection.Text: An institution shall, before entering into a credit agreement with a person, other than a person referred to in subsection (1), disclose to the person prescribed information.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Applications for credit, payment or charge card
Subsection.Text: An institution shall disclose in any application forms or related documents that it prepares for the issuance of credit, payment or charge cards

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a credit card,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a list of all non-interest charges,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the information referred to in paragraph (1)(a),

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the day on which interest begins to accrue and information concerning any grace period that applies, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: any prescribed information; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a payment or charge card, any prescribed information.

Subsection.Text: An institution shall, after entering into a credit agreement with a person, disclose prescribed information to the person.
An institution shall disclose to the person with whom it has entered into a credit agreement

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: any prescribed amendment to the terms or conditions of the credit agreement; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: any prescribed information resulting from the amendment.

Subsection.Text: An institution shall disclose to the person with whom it has entered into a credit agreement any prescribed information respecting the renewal of the credit agreement.

Section.Text: The cost of borrowing shall be calculated, in the prescribed manner, on the basis that all obligations of the borrower are fulfilled and shall be expressed as a rate per annum and, in the prescribed circumstances, as an amount in dollars and cents.

An institution that makes a prescribed representation in an advertisement in Canada for a product that may be obtained by a natural person under a credit agreement shall disclose prescribed information in the advertisement.

Subsection.Text: An institution shall, before entering into an agreement with a person for the issuance of a prepaid payment product, disclose to the person

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the issuing institution;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the day on which the product expires, if any;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if it is a promotional product, the day, if any, on which the person’s right to use the funds that are loaded on the product will expire;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a toll-free telephone number that can be used to make inquiries about the prepaid payment product, including its balance and the terms or conditions with respect to the product, and to make complaints;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the following restrictions on the use of the product, if imposed by the issuing institution:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the fact that the product is not reloadable,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the fact that the product cannot be used to make withdrawals, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: any other restriction that could reasonably be expected to affect the person’s decision to enter into the agreement;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: all charges that may be imposed on the person by the issuing institution in respect of the product;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: if the funds that are loaded on the product are not insured by the Canada Deposit Insurance Corporation, a statement to that effect;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: a statement indicating

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a promotional product, either that the person’s right to use the funds that are loaded on the product will not expire, or that that right will expire, along with the expiry date, as the case may be, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of any other prepaid payment product, that the person’s right to use the funds that are loaded on the product will not expire;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: a website address where the information referred to in paragraphs (a) and (d) to (g) can be obtained; and

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: any prescribed information.

Subsection.Text: The institution shall disclose the information set out in paragraphs (1)(a) to (d) and (i) by setting it out directly on the prepaid payment product or, if the product is electronic, by disclosing it electronically on the person’s request.

Section.Text: An institution shall not increase any charge or impose a new charge associated with a prepaid payment product that is issued to a natural person unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the person has provided the institution with their name and mailing or email address;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the institution has given the person the opportunity to modify the information referred to in paragraph (a); and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the institution discloses the new or increased charge by

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: sending a notice to the most recent address provided for the person at least 30 days before the effective date of the new or increased charge, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: displaying a notice on the institution’s website for a period of at least 60 days ending on the effective date of the new or increased charge.

Subsection.Text: An institution shall, before entering into an agreement with a natural person other than for business purposes for an optional product or service, disclose to the person the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the optional product or service;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the term of the agreement;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a list of all charges that will be imposed for the use of the product or service, or the method used for determining the charges and an example to illustrate the method;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the conditions under which the person may cancel the agreement;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the date from which the product or service is available for use and, if different, from which charges apply; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the steps required to use the product or service.

Subsection.Text: Before entering into the agreement, the institution shall also disclose

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the fact that the person may cancel the agreement by notifying the institution that the agreement is to be cancelled;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the fact that the cancellation will take effect on the last day of the billing cycle, or 30 days after the institution receives the notification, whichever is earlier; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the fact that it shall, without delay on receipt of the notification, refund or credit to the person any amount that it received for any part of the product or service that will be unused from the effective date of the cancellation, to be calculated in accordance with the prescribed formula.

Section.Text: The institution shall, immediately before obtaining a person’s express consent under section 627.42, disclose to the person the information set out in paragraphs 627.94(1)(b) to (e) and subsection 627.94(2) and,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if consent is to be obtained under subsection 627.42(1), the day on which the person will no longer benefit from the offer; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if consent is to be obtained under subsection 627.42(2), the fact that the person no longer benefits from the offer.

Section.Text: If an institution makes an amendment to a term or condition of an agreement referred to in section 627.94 that results in a change to the information that was required to be disclosed under that section, the institution shall, at least 30 days before the day on which the amendment takes effect, disclose that change to the person.

If an optional product or service, other than one provided in relation to a credit agreement, is provided on an ongoing basis by an institution, the institution shall, as part of any disclosure that it is required to make under section 627.95 or 627.96, disclose the information set out in paragraph 627.94(1)(d) and subsection 627.94(2).
An institution shall disclose a list of all charges applicable to registered products by

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: making the list available

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: at each of its branches in Canada and points of service where it offers registered products, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: on each of its websites through which it offers registered products in Canada; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: providing the list to any person who requests it.

Section.Text: An institution shall, before entering into an agreement with a person for a registered product in Canada, disclose to the person

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: information about all charges applicable to the product;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: information about how the person will be notified of any increase in those charges and of any new charges applicable to the product; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: any prescribed information.

Section.Text: An institution shall, before any amendment that it makes to a term or condition with respect to a registered product takes effect, disclose the amendment to the person to whom the product was issued.

Subsection.Text: If an institution or any of its affiliates imposes a charge for insurance or a guarantee that the institution obtains against default on a loan made in Canada on the security of residential property, the institution shall disclose prescribed information and any other information that could reasonably be expected to have an impact on a borrower by

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: making the information available

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: at each of its branches in Canada and points of service where it offers residential mortgages, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: on each of its websites through which it offers residential mortgages in Canada; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: providing the information to any person who requests it.

Subsection.Text: An institution shall, before entering into an agreement under which such a charge is imposed on a person, disclose prescribed information to the person and any other information that could reasonably be expected to have an impact on the person.

A member bank that closes a retail deposit-taking branch — or that ceases to open retail deposit accounts or to disburse cash to customers through a natural person at a retail deposit-taking branch — shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: give a written notice to the Commissioner not later than

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: four months before the date proposed for the closure of the branch or the cessation of the activity, if the branch is in an urban area or in a rural area where there is another retail deposit-taking branch within a travelling distance of 10 km from the branch, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: six months before the date proposed for the closure of the branch or the cessation of the activity, if the branch is in a rural area where there is no other retail deposit-taking branch within a travelling distance of 10 km from the branch;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: give a written notice to each customer of the branch and to the public not later than four months before the date proposed for the closure of the branch or the cessation of the activity, if the branch is in an urban area or in a rural area where there is another retail deposit-taking branch within a travelling distance of 10 km from the branch; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: give a written notice to each customer of the branch, to the public and to the chairperson, mayor, warden, reeve or other similar chief officer of the municipal or local government body or authority for the area in which the branch is located not later than six months before the date proposed for the closure of the branch or the cessation of the activity, if the branch is in a rural area where there is no other retail deposit-taking branch within a travelling distance of 10 km from the branch.

Subsection.Text: The member bank shall give the notice to the public by

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: displaying it prominently at the branch; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the notice is one that is required under paragraph (1)(c), publishing it in a newspaper in general circulation at or near the place where the branch is located.

Subsection.Text: The notice shall include prescribed information.

Section.Text: In prescribed circumstances, the Commissioner may, on the request of a member bank, exempt it from the requirement to give a notice under section 627.993 or vary the time and manner in which such a notice is required to be given.

Subsection.Text: After a notice is given but before the branch is closed or ceases to carry on the activity, the Commissioner shall require the member bank to convene and hold a meeting between representatives of the bank, representatives of the Agency and interested persons in the area affected by the closure of the branch or the cessation of the activity in order to exchange views about the closure of the branch or the cessation of the activity, including alternate service delivery by the bank and measures to help the branch’s customers adjust to the closure or the cessation of the activity, if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the member bank has not consulted in the area well enough to ascertain the views of interested persons in the area with regard to the closure of the branch, the cessation of the activity, alternate service delivery by the bank or measures to help the branch’s customers adjust to the closure or the cessation of the activity; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: an area representative or a person from the area submits to the Commissioner a request for the meeting and the request is not frivolous or vexatious.

Subsection.Text: The Commissioner may establish rules for the convening and conduct of a meeting.
The Statutory Instruments Act does not apply to rules established under subsection (2).
A bank with equity of $1,000,000,000 or more shall, within 135 days after the end of each financial year,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: file a written statement with the Commissioner that includes, for that financial year,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: prescribed information with respect to the contribution of the bank and its prescribed affiliates to the Canadian economy and society and with respect to any other matter,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the names of the voluntary codes of conduct that it has adopted, that are designed to protect the interests of its customers and that are publicly available — and of any public commitments that it has made and that are designed to protect the interests of its customers — along with the means by which the codes and commitments are made available to its customers and the public,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a description of the measures taken by the bank and its prescribed affiliates to provide products and services to low-income persons, senior persons, persons with disabilities and persons who face accessibility, linguistic or literacy challenges, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: a description of the consultations undertaken by the bank and its prescribed affiliates with their customers and the public in relation to

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: existing products and services, including the means by which they are provided,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: the development of new products and services, including the means by which they would be provided,

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: the identification of trends and emerging issues that may have an impact on their customers or the public, and

Clause.Label: (D)
Clause.Text: matters in respect of which the bank has received complaints; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: inform its customers and the public, through advertising, making public announcements, posting notices, mailing information or otherwise, about the means by which the statement is made available to them.

Subsection.Text: A bank is not required to include in the statement the information required under subparagraphs (1)(a)(i), (iii) and (iv) with respect to a prescribed affiliate if a company referred to in subsection 489.1(1) of the Insurance Companies Act or subsection 444.2(1) of the Trust and Loan Companies Act has already published that information in its statement published under those subsections.
The bank shall make the statement available free of charge

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: on each of its websites through which it offers products or services in Canada; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: by providing it to any person who requests it.

Section.MarginalNote: Credit or refund of charge or penalty

Subsection.Text: An institution shall, if it has imposed a charge or penalty in relation to a product or service,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: credit the amount of the charge or penalty or, if it was collected, refund the amount if the charge or penalty was not provided for in an agreement; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: credit the excess amount of the charge or penalty or, if it was collected, refund the excess amount if the charge or penalty was greater than the amount of charge or penalty that was provided for in an agreement.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Credit or refund of charge or penalty — no express consent
Subsection.Text: An institution shall, if it has provided a person with a product or service without first having obtained from the person the express consent referred to in paragraph 627.08(1)(a), and if it has imposed a charge or penalty on the person in relation to the product or service, credit the amount of the charge or penalty or, if it was collected, refund the amount.

The amount referred to in subsections (1) and (2) bears interest from the day on which it was imposed, at a rate equal to the Bank of Canada’s overnight rate on that day, until the day on which the amount is refunded or credited.

Section.Text: The Governor in Council may make regulations respecting any matters involving an institution’s dealings, or the dealings of its employees, representatives, agents or other intermediaries, with customers or the public, any matters involving products or services that are the subject of those dealings and any matters involving an institution that is acting in the capacity of a representative, agent or other intermediary for another entity, including regulations

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: requiring the disclosure of information;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: respecting the training of an institution’s employees, representatives, agents or other intermediaries;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: respecting the content of advertisements and the manner in which it is displayed or communicated;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: respecting the rebate or refund of any amounts paid or to be paid in relation to the provision of a product or service;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: prescribing what an institution may, shall or shall not do — including in relation to the imposition of charges or penalties — in carrying out any of the activities that it is permitted to carry out, or in providing any of the services that it is permitted to provide, under section 409 or 538 and any ancillary, related or incidental activities or services;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: respecting the names of positions to be used by an institution’s employees, representatives, agents or other intermediaries in their dealings with customers or the public;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: prescribing the time at which and the manner in which any of the activities referred to in paragraph (e) are to be carried out or any of the services referred to in that paragraph are to be provided;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: prescribing when documents and information that are required to be disclosed, sent or otherwise provided under this Part are deemed to have been provided;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: prescribing the manner in which any information that is required to be filed, disclosed, made available or otherwise provided under this Part is to be organized or broken down;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: prescribing the time at which and the manner in which any information that is required to be filed, disclosed, made available or otherwise provided under this Part is to be filed, disclosed, made available or otherwise provided;

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: prescribing the circumstances in which all or part of sections 627.08, 627.17, 627.28, 627.3, 627.31, 627.59, 627.72, 627.89, 627.99, 627.992 and 627.993 do not apply;

Paragraph.Label: (l)
Paragraph.Text: specifying conduct that shall be considered or shall not be considered coercion for the purpose of paragraph 627.04(a);

Paragraph.Label: (m)
Paragraph.Text: requiring a member bank, at any point of service or any branch in Canada at which it opens retail deposit accounts through natural persons, to open, at the request of a natural person who meets the prescribed conditions, a low-cost or no-cost retail deposit account for the person, and prescribing the characteristics of such an account, including the name of the account;

Paragraph.Label: (n)
Paragraph.Text: respecting the collection, retention, use or disclosure of information about a customer and the manner in which complaints by the customer in relation to that collection, retention, use or disclosure are to be dealt with; and

Paragraph.Label: (o)
Paragraph.Text: respecting the requirements to be met by the external complaints body.

Subsection.Text: A bank shall provide the Superintendent with such information, at such times and in such form as the Superintendent may require.
A bank shall, within thirty days after each annual meeting of the bank, provide the Superintendent with a return showing

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name, residence and citizenship of each director holding office immediately following the meeting;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the mailing address of each director holding office immediately following the meeting;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the bodies corporate of which each director referred to in paragraph (a) is an officer or director and the firms of which each director is a member;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the affiliation, within the meaning of section 162, with the bank of each director referred to in paragraph (a);

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the names of the directors referred to in paragraph (a) who are officers or employees of the bank or any affiliate of the bank, and the positions they occupy;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the name of each committee of the bank on which each director referred to in paragraph (a) serves;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the date of expiration of the term of each director referred to in paragraph (a); and

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the name, address and date of appointment of the auditor or auditors of the bank.

Subsection.Text: Where

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: any information relating to a director or an auditor of a bank shown in the latest return made to the Superintendent under subsection (1), other than information referred to in paragraph (1)(c) or (d), becomes inaccurate or incomplete,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a vacancy in the office of auditor of the bank occurs or is filled by another person, or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a vacancy on the board of directors of the bank occurs or is filled,

ContinuedSectionSubsection.Text: the bank shall forthwith provide the Superintendent with such information as is required to maintain the return in a complete and accurate form.

Section.Text: A bank shall send to the Superintendent, within thirty days after the coming into effect of a by-law or an amendment to a by-law, a copy of the by-law or amendment.

Subsection.Text: The Superintendent shall, in respect of each bank for which an order approving the commencement and carrying on of business has been made, cause a register to be maintained containing a copy of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the incorporating instrument of the bank; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the information referred to in paragraphs 632(1)(a), (c) and (e) to (h) contained in the latest return sent to the Superintendent under section 632.

Subsection.Text: The register may be maintained in

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a bound or loose-leaf form or in a photographic film form; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
